text: Today marks the 109th birthday of Taiwan. I continue to stand in support of the Taiwanese people, who continue to stand up for freedom and democracy, holding strong against the Chinese Communist Party.

The vast majority of Americans want the Senate to pass additional COVID-19 relief legislation instead of pushing through a Supreme Court confirmation.

Countless Americans are hanging on to their homes by a thread—they must be our priority.

It comes down to this: months into a global pandemic that has killed more than 214,000 Americans, Senate Republicans are pushing through a SCOTUS confirmation instead of taking up legislation to help people get through the worst health crisis our country has seen in a century.
Every member on the Senate Judiciary Committee must be tested for COVID-19 before the Supreme Court confirmation hearings start on Monday.

The health of our people, planet, economy, justice system and democracy is on the ballot. 

To my constituents of #SanFrancisco: I respectfully ask for your continued support for my re-election. 

Together, we will win a great Democratic victory. -NP #CA12 #TeamPelosi http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1314951731357331456/pu/img/bFMQUF7TcQwveL76.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1314951731357331456/pu/vid/320x320/l8dzhxCxwIwafxud.mp4?tag=10

.@NolanRyan76 on my National Child Identification Act: "As a father and grandfather, I can’t think of anything more important than protecting children and this bill will help do that.”

On my National Child Identification Act @CoachMSing said: “As parents of adult children, Kim and I are most thankful for the National Child Identification Act in time for our grandchildren to benefit.”

This week, I introduced the National Child Identification Act, legislation that would help law enforcement distribute child ID kits to parents in communities. Keeping kids safe through commonsense measures is a nonpartisan issue, & I am hopeful that Congress will pass this bill.

I was an original cosponsor of #SavannasAct when it was first introduced in 2017. I'm glad it & the #NotInvisible Act – a pair of important bipartisan bills to address the crisis of murdered & missing Indigenous women & girls – are finally law. It's about time. #MMIWG https://twitter.com/CraigCaplan/status/1315043571880296448 QT @CraigCaplan Savanna's Act, which establish national law enforcement guidelines between federal gov't & American Indian tribes for reporting on missing & murdered Native Americans, was signed into law by President Trump today. (1) Dan Rather, for decades CBS’s lead news anchor, doesn’t know what court “packing” (increasing—as FDR tried to do—SCOTUS from 9 Justices to a larger number, for political benefit) is; or
